channel.title: Q: How to make monster attack you after you range them?
channel.description:
Ok, this is what I have got so far:
ver 1: I range monster, I get teleported to him and fighting is like normal, with 3 rounds and all
ver 2: I range monster, he will attack me instantly and his sprite is where he was before.
On both of these versions, if I attack a player with ranged, he will suddenly be like mob - forced to attack me.
How to make monster follow you after you range him/her and then finally attack you, when he reaches you?
I have so far used statement: if(!affectedMob.isBusy){<here goes all that code>} and only edited RangeEvent. Should I do dealing with AttackHandler/FightEvent? Or can I mount it all to RangeEvent? And how to fix those bugs or what way should be more efficient?
Thanks in advance, sTaShah.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 12, 2008, 10:27:23 am[/size][hr]Bump.

item.title: Q: How to make monster attack you after you range them?
item.dc:creator: @force force
item.description:
@force wrote:

Make follow event usable by npcs.

Enable it and check until npc is within 2 sqrs of player then attack

But also remember to stop the npc if it goes outside of a certain bounds or it will follow the player around the map
